output: slidy_presentation
runtime: shiny_prerendered
title: "Slidly demo"
description: >
  This tutorial demonstrates how one can use dygraphs (with the dygraph package)
  as part of a learnr tutorial from Bernd.
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(learnr)
library(dygraphs)
```

## Time Series with dygraphs (Heesen)

Modify the dyOptions to customize the graph's appearance from Bernd:

```{r dygraph-options, exercise=TRUE, exercise.eval=TRUE, fig.height=5.5}
dygraph(ldeaths) %>%
  dyOptions(fillGraph = FALSE, drawGrid = TRUE)
knitr::include_graphics("images/transform-logical.png")
```
